CARDINAL . ORG held that the electoral deposit was not a direct or indirect limitation of the right to stand for election , since it did not predetermine the citizen ’s right to elect or be elected . The deposit was no more than a precondition for the candidate ’s registration by the electoral commission . All candidates had to pay the same amount , irrespective of their financial situation , and thus it could not be considered discriminatory on grounds of property . The electoral deposit was intended both to encourage a responsible attitude towards elections on the part of potential candidates and to prevent an abuse of electoral rights . Moreover , it was aimed at preventing excessive or unreasonable expenditure of the ORG funds allocated to cover candidates’ costs .
